alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lost River Range; Lost River Valleys; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 7:12PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BAND OF MODERATE SNOW AND LOWER VALLEY RAIN CONTINUES TO WORK EAST THROUGH THE REGION THIS EVENING... At 707 PM MST, a band of moderate snow and lower valley rain was located along a line extending from near Central Inl to near Portneuf Gap to 6 miles northeast of Snowville. Movement was east at 35 mph. Moderate snow has been observed along this band from Carey to Arco and across the southern mountains. A mix of rain and snow has been observed along the Interstate 86 corridor east of Yale. Visibility has been reduced to a half to a quarter mile at times within this band. Motorists traveling through southeast Idaho this evening should be prepared for adverse winter driving conditions this evening and be ready to slow down when encountering snow covered roads. Locations impacted include... Idaho Falls, Pocatello, Rexburg, Blackfoot, Preston, American Falls, Rigby, Soda Springs, Montpelier, Malad, Arco, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Swan Valley, Swanlake, Ririe Reservoir, Neeley, Blackfoot Reservoir, Terreton and Lorenzo. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one inch per hour in this band. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this band of heavy snow. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect for the area. Please monitor local media outlets and the National Weather Service for further statements.
